net.sf.mmm.music.datatype.api

Class Tone

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.music.datatype.api.Tone
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transposable<Tone>

    public class Tone
extends Object
implements Transposable<Tone>
    A Tone is an absolute tone as the combination of a TonePitch with an octave. While a TonePitch only identifies a tone within an octave a Tone can identify any
    Author:
    hohwille

      Tone transposeChromatic(int semitoneSteps, EnharmonicStyle style)
      This method transposes this object by the given number of semitoneSteps wrapping TonePitches within the chromatic scale and using the given style for enharmonic changes.

    • Method Detail

      • getPitch

        public TonePitch getPitch()
        Returns:
        the TonePitch within the octave.

      • getOctave

        public int getOctave()
        Returns:
        the octave the pitch is located. A value of 0 is the regular octave in violin-clef starting with the low C (below the scale) and ending with B in the middle of the scale. A positive value is used to go up an octave to higher pitches and a negative value is used to go down (e.g. -1 and -2 for bass-clef).

      • transposeChromatic

        public Tone transposeChromatic(int semitoneSteps,
                               EnharmonicStyle style)
        Description copied from interface: Transposable
        This method transposes this object by the given number of semitoneSteps wrapping TonePitches within the chromatic scale and using the given style for enharmonic changes.
        Specified by:
        transposeChromatic in interface Transposable<Tone>
        Parameters:
        semitoneSteps - is the number of semitone steps to transpose.
        style - the EnharmonicStyle.
        Returns:
        the transposed Tone.
        See Also:
        TonePitch.transposeChromatic(int, EnharmonicStyle)

      • transposeChromatic

                               MusicalKey targetKey)
        Description copied from interface: Transposable
        This method transposes this object by the given number of semitoneSteps wrapping TonePitches within the chromatic scale of the given MusicalKey.
        Specified by:
        transposeChromatic in interface Transposable<Tone>
        Parameters:
        semitoneSteps - is the number of semitone steps to transpose.
        targetKey - is the target key.
        Returns:
        the transposed Tone with enharmonic change according to the given MusicalKey.
